Authors: Pangestu H., Karsen M., Chandra Y.U.
Title: Evaluation of Collaborative Learning Tools Implementation to Improve Learning Quality in Higher Education
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pangestu, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Karsen, M., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chandra, Y.U., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Learning processes are now shifting from traditional learning to the collaborative learning process. Collaborative Learning means group-based environment that combination of lecturing in big class and case study in tutorial class. This research discusses the best practice of collaborative learning to measure collaborative learning implementation in higher education, that improve the quality of collaborative learning implementation. This study contains an evaluation of collaborative learning in courses of information systems based on the subjective perspective of students. The primary data collected during this research consist of 243 respondents as students. The courses that being analyzed in this research are Information System Concept and Management Information System course. Data analysis was using SEM-PLS. This research has 3 (three) hypotheses that already tested, and the result is accept the Content Delivery (CD), but not significant with Planning and Organization (PO), and Learning Methodology (LM). Based on the result, the conclusion for best practice implementation of collaborative learning was to improve the content delivery material and how to deliver the content, such as selecting collaboration tools, capable lecturers, adding more video and fun grouping, also use different learning methods, such as flipped learning, online quiz to make the classroom situation fun and not boring for students. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: collaboration tools; collaborative learning; collaborative learning quality; evaluation; quality

Title: Evaluation of usability in online learning
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pangestu, H., Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Karsen, M., Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Online learning is one of alternative to improve quality of teaching and learning process in higher education between lecturer and the students, esspecially for the working people with time and place as obstacles for them to continue their education to a higher level. One of the success factor in e-learning is good web usability. With the increasing number of users of e-learning and the importance of user satisfaction, it is necessary to evaluate e-learning web usability. This research discussed the usability of online learning in higher Education, especially Binus University. The purpose of this research is evaluating e-learning web usability by using USE questionnaire to survey e-learning perception from the users that can improve the quality of e-learning. The data collected during this research are using questionnaires with total 37 respondents which are online learning students. The USE Questionnaire based on several criterias, as Usefulness, Satisfaction, Ease of Learning and Ease of Use, then evaluation, analysis, and interpretation of data. The final results of this study conclude that Binus Online Learning still need improvement on ease of use and satisfaction categories so as to provide better usability to the users. © 2016 IEEE.
